fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An extra zero led an article to overstate by a factor of 10 the number of online applicants for social housing in Amsterdam. The correct figure is 60,000 (Officials turn to ‘doughnut’ economics as alternative to growth, 8 April, page 31). • The clue for 12 across in Cryptic crossword No 28,096, “Sovereign in charge is unrestricted”, called for FREE, not TREE as given in the solution (2 April, page 12, Journal). • Other recently amended articles include: This crisis has changed our experience of home – and exposed the deep pain of poor housing Twitter chief to donate quarter of his fortune to coronavirus fight ‘The NHS needs them’: UK urged to join countries mobilising migrant medics Air pollution linked to far higher Covid-19 death rates, study finds Face masks cannot stop healthy people getting Covid-19, says WHO Covid-19: ex-supreme court judge lambasts ‘disgraceful’ policing UK police warned against ‘overreach’ in use of virus lockdown powers Duffy’s brave account highlights why so few rape victims speak up How we made the Big Issue magazine
